alert.note: Alert for Manua; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 11 at 2:50PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 11 to 13 feet will impact all shores of American Samoa, mainly north and west shores. * TIMING...through tonight * IMPACTS...High surfs and strong rip currents. Fautuaga mo galu maualuluga Ofisa o le tau Pago Pago AS 250 AOAULI ASO LUA IANUARI 11 2022 ...O loo faaauau Fautuaga mo Galu maualuluga... * GALU...O galu e 11 i le 13 futu le maualuluga o le a aafia ai talafatai uma o le atunu`u ae maise talafatai i matu ma sisifo o le atunu`u. * TAIMI...seia oo i le po nanei. * NOFOAGA AAFIA...E maualuluga galu ma malosi le aave o le sami. FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... O fautuaga mo galu maualuluga e faailoa mai ai le malolosi ma le tetele o galu o le a aafia ai gataifale ma matafaga, ma o le a malolosi aave o le sami e ono solo ai nisi o vaega o le matafaga. Ona o le siisii o peau o le sami, e fautuaina ai le mamalu lautele ma le au fai faiva ina ia faautagia mai lenei fautuaga ona o le maualuluga o galu ua iai nei.
info.instruction: A high surf advisory indicates large breaking waves will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing dangerous rip currents and localized beach erosion. Also, it is extremely dangerous to fish or observe waves from rocks during high surf conditions. Unwary beach walkers can be caught off guard as waves suddenly race farther up the beach than normal.
